Kural_Info.Chapter: இனியவை கூறல் (The Utterance of Pleasant Words)
Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: அல்லவை தேய அறம்பெருகும் நல்லவைநாடி இனிய சொலின்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: If a man, while seeking to speak usefully, speaks also sweetly, his sins will diminish and his virtue increase.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A person is speaking. Their words are visualized as a stream of golden particles of light, representing sweet and good speech ('இனிய சொலின்', 'நல்லவை நாடி').
Layered_Composition.Midground: This stream of light has a dual effect. On one side, it flows over a patch of dark, thorny weeds representing 'vices' ('அல்லவை'), causing them to wither and fade away ('தேய'). On the other side, it flows over a small, tender sapling representing 'virtue' ('அறம்'), causing it to grow rapidly and flourish ('பெருகும்').
Layered_Composition.Background: A balanced, serene landscape, suggesting the inner equilibrium achieved through this kind of speech.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The act of speaking sweet and good words has a powerful, transformative effect: it simultaneously causes one's vices to diminish and one's virtues to grow.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The duality of the speech's effect is the key visual. The golden light of the words acts as both a purifying agent that destroys evil and a nurturing agent that cultivates good.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The central stream of golden speech is the main light source. It casts a destructive, fading light on the dark thorns and a life-giving, vibrant light on the green sapling.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A wide shot that captures the speaker and the full transformative effect of their words on the symbolic landscape of their soul.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic, with magical particle effects for the speech and time-lapse effects for the withering thorns and growing tree.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Symbolic lighting that clearly shows the dual destructive/creative power of the spoken words.

Cultural_Anchors: Seeking the good and speaking sweetly (நல்லவை நாடி இனிய சொலின்)
